comments:
This class provides students with tools to understand how policies and programs progress within the arena of policy.  This class will focus on a revise “garbage can model” of organization choice presented by John Kingdon. Students design and implement strategies for introducing and enact policies and how and why policy change occurs.
Overall, students enjoyed the material taught in the class and many students felt that they “walked away with a much better understanding of the process.” However, a few students felt that the subject matter was “dry and boring.”
Student’s considered Dr. Pearson to be a “thoughtful”, “prepared” and “thorough” instructor.  They commented on the high quality of the lectures and class discussions. However, a few students felt that the “assignments were a waste of time” 
This class was composed of mostly upperclassman and used to fulfill elective or major requirements.
